page.title: 18Keadby Village
page.content: It is situated on the western bank of the River Trent.The housing is mainly terrace or semi-detached.There are a few light industries,two petrol stations and a fish and chip shop.The present Post Office was originally built as a fish and chip shop.The postmaster travels daily from Alkborough.The library is housed in a modern building in Station Road which started life as an office for the Water Catchment Board and stands on the site of the old village institute known as the Tin Tabernacle.The village boasts 3 public houses all within site of one another,built to satisfy the thirsts of the barge crews and seamen from the wharf,in olden days.An application is at present being considered re the development of the British Waterways Board jetty.
